dialogues.text: My problem, shitbird, is that I tried to blow my fucking head off and wound up sucking blood clots for the last year and a half!  Now you're standing there choking your chicken like we're all walking around some fucking candy-ass vampire sitcom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud attempts to show some balls, but stammers all the sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you think I don't know what's at stake here?  We practically compromised our whole operation to save your puckered old ass!  And for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs Scud's shirt) Our operation?!  Our operation?!  I built this operation, you fucking turd stain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, however, an alarm starts BEEPING.  Scud checks display as Blade readies his MACH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motion sensors.  Looks like Zone Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud checks a series of thermal signature displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body temp's fifty so I'll guess suck head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud looks to a bank of security monitors -- the views br into static as a FIGURE rushes past them.  He tries a few keyboard commands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, I'm not getting anything on the surveillance cams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler makes a few adjustments on the nearest monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fried.  Whoever's out there is using magnesium flares.  Seems like they've got your security system stopped out pretty well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler moves to a rack of weaponry.  As he reaches for 15, Scud moves to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, easy cowboy - I'm not trusting you with a weapon just yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler SMACKS Scud in the face with the butt of the CAR and pushes past him.  We hear a CRASH.

dialogues.speaker: TWO BLACK, LATEX-CLAD, NINJA LIKE INTRUDERS
dialogues.text: Running on all fours, racing upside down across the ceili at break-neck speed.  Then they drop, somersaulting down fifty feet, landing in a cat-like stance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit the God-lights.

dialogues.text: Scud, with his nose now bleeding, activates a series of stadium-style lights secured to the ceiling.  The entire place goes white with UV light, the image nearly blowing

dialogues.speaker: FIGURES' FACES
dialogues.text: They are wearing metal goggles with iris shut to mere pin prick openings. Whistler trains the CAR-15 on --

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST LATEX CLAD FIGURE
dialogues.text: Who is now removing something from a satchel.  Whistler FIRES.  The Intruder drops the object and cartwheels away In the blink of an eye, the Second Intruder has launched himself at Whistler, hand-springing off the floor, then kicking him in the mid-section.  As Whistler falls back, Second Intruder presses forward.

dialogues.speaker: ON BLADE
dialogues.text: Unsheathing his sword, rushing at the First Intruder. WHAP!  The Intruder traps Blade's forearm, pivoting, plan a boot in Blade's ribcage.  Obviously, the Intruder is a serious martial arts student. WHAP!WHAP!WHAP!  The two of them go at it, unleashing a flurry of kicks, blocks, and punches.  The Intruder gets Blade in a back-choke.  He twists out of it, throwing the Intruder over his shoulder, who neatly cartwheels, spring back off the wall at Blade again -- Blade ducks beneath one of the Intruder's kicks, then tra the Intruder's foot, giving it a savage twist.  CRACK!  B backhands the intruder with a blow so strong that it knoc the Intruder to his knees.  Then the Intruder reaches for short sword.  In a heartbeat, the sword is out and agains Blade's throat.  Just as Blade's sword is not against the Intruder's.  It's a stalemate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and the First Intruder freeze.  The Second Intruder steps away from Whistler, whom he clearly had the drop on and tosses the CAR-15 to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't come here to fight.  We came to deliver a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade looks back to the First Intruder.  Then slowly withdraws his sword.  The Intruder does the same.  Blade turns off the God-lights.  The UVs fade and normal lighti returns.  Scud and Whistler pick themselves up off the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Intruders remove their masks.  The first is ASAD, a cautious Sufi Muslim possessing a restrained nobility. The second is a woman, NYSSA.  20-something, with emerald eyes and strong, darkly exotic features.  Both are Vampir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Asad.  This is Nyssa.  We represent the Shadow Cabinet.  The ruling body of Vampire nation.  They're offering you a truce.  They want to meet with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wiping blood from his nose) Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade holds up his hand, silencing Scud's outburst.  He n for Nyssa and Asad to continue. Nyssa slowly crouches and reaches for the object she drop - a CD.  She tosses it to Blade.  Still keeping an eye on them, Blade slips the CD into a reader.  We SEE a slide-s of video capture shots taken from a surveillance camera. Nomak tearing into the blood bank staff, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For decades you've been the thing we've feared the most.  But there's something else loose on the streets now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The final still.  A blurry, horrific shot of Nomak's half turned face and back.  We get a sense of distorted, inhum physiognomy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something worse than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade, Whistler, and Scud stand near the ledge, while Asa stands a few yards off, talking on a phone.  Nyssa stands even further away, watching them with distrust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole deal's giving me a serious case of the butt-willies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, kid, they obviously found your base of operations.  If it was a trap, why flip their dicks by announcing themselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree.  We play along for now, we might wind up learning something about how their world ticks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning at Scud) Either that or feeding the worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asad finishes his call and approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're ready to see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if on cue, we hear the THRUM of helicopters.  Seconds later, two Bell Jet Rangers appear above them, illuminati them in their searchlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We track the helicopters across the night sky.  We SEE Whistler and Asad in one, Blade, Scud and Nyssa in anothe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Nyssa sit in the rear of the first helicopter. Nyssa is studying Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell bedtime stories about you. Blade the big, bad boogie-man.  Frankly, I'm disappointed. (Blade raises an eyebrow) That you were willing to come along so easily, I mean.  Without any assurances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade smiles and opens his coat, gesturing to a bandolier plastic explosives secured to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semtex explosive.  Enough to level a city block.  How's that for assurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter abruptly banks right, dropping down low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bell Jet Rangers touch down outside a terraced, Frank Lloyd Wright structure overlooking the ocean.  As Nyssa a Asad lead Blade, Whistler and Scud towards the facility w SEE a circular crimson logo encircling a double-helix. Scud notices a series of RED LIGHT DOTS on his arms and chest.  He looks up to see DOZENS OF VAMPIRE MARKSMEN on roofs above, training their weapons on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group rides down.  The elevator stops.  The doors ope

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa and Asad lead them into a hub out of which multiple corridors project.  They take the central corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corridor ends at a pair of steel security doors.  Nys stands before a biometric scanner, allowing a beam of lig to play over her face.  The scanner acknowledges her iden and the doors HISS open, revealing a series of security d beyond these which successively open into --

dialogues.speaker: A FINAL DOOR
dialogues.text: Oak, set into a stainless steel wall.  Incalculably ancie elaborately carved.  Brought over from the "Old World."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The House of Erebus you encountered before were nothing but feudal lords. The true power of the Vampire Nation lies here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move towards the final door, Whistler shivers.  S watches as his breath escapes from his mouth in a frosty plume.  Asad takes notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few warmbloods have seen what's beyond this door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the doors open into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crescent-shaped room filled with antiquities: quarry columns from Middle Kingdom Egypt, stacks of arcane volum Medieval frontispieces.  A Borgia-esque Renaissance portr staring down at us with a severe gaze.  Towering over all these is a massive Greek Cross carved from stone.  MUSIC echoes around them -- Boito's Faust.  Standing in the mid of this is OVERLORD ELI DAMASKINOS, wearing a robe of bla silk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos holds up his hand.  He waits for the music to crescendo, then turns, his face still hidden in shadow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you don't mind the cold.  When one such as myself reaches an advanced age, certain precautions are needed in order to preserve the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade, this is Overlord Eli Damaskinos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in vampire dialect; subtitled) Welcome, Daywalker.  I thank you for coming.  I've been anxious to meet you for quite some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos draws closer now, stepping into the light.  Br eyed with smile like moonlight gleaming off a knife blade His skin is impossibly pale, almost marble-like, with traceries of blue blood pulsing underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the late Abraham Whistler.  I trust your time amongst our numbers was agreeable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler glares at Damaskinos.  The two men stare at each other a moment, sizing one another up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling knowingly) It has been said, you may have enemies whom you hate, but not enemies whom you despise.  Be proud of your enemy: then his success shall be yours, too.  In that regard, I should thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eliminating Deacon Frost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARTER STEVENS, an officious-looking familiar who has bee quietly watching from the wings now steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that unseemly business with LaMagra. You did us a favor. (offering his hand to Blade) Carter Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Blade and Stevens shake, Blade notices a vampire glyph poking out from beneath the familiar's shirt cuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Barely.  I'm a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens works with the National Institute of Health. (off Blade's look) Given that they monitor the nation's blood supply, a strategic alliance seemed prudent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also finance a number of humanitarian organizations -- the National Institute of Infectious Diseases for one, the Human Genome Project...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and the others turn to Nyssa, who uses a complex mechanical key to activate a holo-projector mounted above table.  As she focuses the image, a 3-D DIORAMA of vampir viral nucleocapsids swirls into view.  The nucelocapsids begin attacking human red blood cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you may know, Vampirism is an arbovirus, one that's spread through the saliva of parasitic organisms -- (motioning to the hologram) In this case, vampires are the vector. The virus replicates within the human bloodstream, evolving its host into an entirely new life-form. (beat) Unfortunately, viruses evolve too --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nyssa talks, one of the viral nucleocapsids changes, mutating from its original, elegant design into a harsher more menacing form. The mutated nucleocapsid begins feeding on the original vampire capsids, causing a chain-reaction of mutation.  I seconds, the holo-image is filled with throbbing, microsc horrors which then mutate into  --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've dubbed this new virus the Reaper Strain.  And like any good pathogen, it appears to have found a carrier -- a "Patient Zero".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rotating 3-D image of Jared Nomak's face.  Eyes red, hi skin in full "blood mode" blush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Jared Nomak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thiavolos, as we used to say in Greece. The Devil.  Pure Thirst.  Nothing more. He was born a vampire, but he is an anomaly. (to Blade) Like you.  Unlike the rest of us, however, he feeds on not just humans, but vampires as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like he's doing me a favor, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're missing the point.  Their vampire victims don't die.  They turn.  They become carriers.  If the Reapers continue unchecked, there could be thousands of them before the month is over.  Do the math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade turns to Damaskinos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) You want me to hunt them for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) Not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been training a small tactical unit -- the Bloodpack.  We want you to lead them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just how long has this little social club of yours been together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they weren't created to go after your "patient zero".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They've been training to hunt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade, Whistler and Scud enter through the loading elevat Blade turns to Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you really think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lighting a cigarette) These guys are shitting bricks cause they're no longer on the top of the food chain.  They're going to fuck us the first chance they get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler moves away.  Blade shrugs off his jacket, begins putting away his weapons.  Scud lingers, apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're going to do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your friends close and your enemies closer.  Isn't that how the saying goes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud follows Blade's gaze, watching Whistler, who has collapsed into a chair at the far end of the workshop.  T grizzled hunter pulls off his leg brace, then massages hi bum knee.  Scud nods in Whistler's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm worried about him. (off Blade's look) Look, I know he's your friend, but just watch him, okay?  Nobody goes cold Turkey from the Thirst in a night.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON WHISTLER
dialogues.text: Surrounded by the salvaged parts and massive gears of lon discarded machinery, half-hidden in shadow.  A shaft of morning sunlight cuts in through one of the windows, slow moving across the floor towards his position.  He shifts his chair, moving slightly -- Away from the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late.  An ice-encased streetlight HUMS and flickers. The pumps are vacant.  A heavy blanket of sooty snow cove the grounds of the station.  The fluorescents of the mini mart are the only beacon of light in an otherwise fog-bou night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KOREAN WOMAN (30s) mans the counter.  Her TODDLER sits circular safety walker nearby.  The kind that rolls and i affixed with toys to keep a baby occupied.  The woman gla at two surveillance monitors.  On the first monitor we se

dialogues.text: pull up to the pumps outside.  A MAN gets out, slides his credit card through the reader, starts pumping gas.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SECOND MONITOR
dialogues.text: We SEE a FIGURE standing at the back by the Slurpee machi The figure turns, approaching.  It's Nomak.  He sets a package of gum on the counter, looks to the baby.  He smi wriggles his finger.  The child COOS and smiles back. Unnerved by Nomak, the Korean woman quickly rings the transaction, gives him his change.  He removes a stick of from the pack, carefully unwraps it, slides it into his mouth, watching the child all the while.  Finally, he nod the woman and leaves.  The door CHIMES as he exits. Beat.  The woman looks to the surveillance monitors again

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST MONITOR
dialogues.text: The car is still there, but the man pumping gas is gone. Puzzled, the woman steps from behind the counter and move the glass doors, looking out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's driver side door hangs open.  Even more disturb the hose for the gas pump lies untended on the icy ground spilling fuel from its nozzle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Korean woman cautiously exits the mini-mart.  No one in sight.  She hurries to the abandoned car, disengaging lock on the pump handle, then setting it back in its crad She looks to the open driver's door.  A FEW DROPLETS OF B have stained the snow just outside it.  Then she sees --

dialogues.speaker: A GHOSTLY FIGURE
dialogues.text: Standing off in the fog-bound shadows.  The woman looks b to the mini-mart, then back again to where the figure was standing.  But the figure is gone!  Growing increasingly anxious, the woman hurries back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman shuts the door, locks it.  But she's still just target standing inside a well-lit glass box.  She moves t the safety walker, scoops up her child. After another moment's indecision, she slides the accordi style gate down over the doors and windows.  Then she tur off the lights.  Feeling somewhat more secure, the woman moves back around the counter and SEES -- An unwrapped stick of gum resting on the tray of the baby walker.  It wasn't there before.  With a rising sense of dread, the woman backs away, bumping right into --

dialogues.speaker: NOMAK
dialogues.text: He smiles cruelly, the scar/seam in his chin just beginni to part.  The woman gasps, turns to run -- and bumps into THREE MORE REAPERS.  Gaunt and feral-looki All three with shaved heads. No eyebrows, and hairline scar/seams running down their chins.  As one, the reapers descend on her.  We hear the child's TERRIFIED WAIL and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sulfur-colored moon shines its baleful light down upon icy cityscape as NOMAK'S ROAR echoes through the canyon o buildings.

dialogues.text: Blade is just finishing injecting himself with serum.  He sighs, falling back into the chair he's sitting in, waiti for the shakes to subside.  He unwraps a piece of rubbing tubing which he'd been using as a tourniquet, flexes his hand. The door to his room opens.  Scud stands there in silhoue

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, we've got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade emerges into the workshop proper with Whistler and Scud.

dialogues.speaker: NYSSA AND BLOODPACK
dialogues.text: Stand before us.  They represent an assortment of ages an races, their one unifying characteristic being a callous, almost fanatical disregard for human life.  In short, the guys are the most stone-cold motherfuckers we've ever see

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well if it isn't Snow White and the Seven Suckheads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their leader, DIETER REINHARDT (30s), is a square-jawed, chiseled Austrian.  Next to Reinhardt is SNOWMAN, a wire albino, LIGHTHAMMER, a massive Blackfoot Indian, and PRIE a bald-headed modern primitive with copious piercings and facial tattoos.  Rounding out the bunch is CHUPA, a blunt featured Puerto Rican, and VERLAINE, a familiar-looking curvaceous beauty with bee-stung lips that exudes a preda sexuality. (NOTE: Verlaine looks familiar because she is the twin si of Raquel, the bodacious vamp played by Traci Lords that Blade killed in the opening scene of the first film.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out, troops.  Count Chocula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vampires LAUGH.  Asad quiets them with a look, then gestures to them in turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade, this is Reinhardt.  That's Snowman, Lighthammer, Priest, Chupa and Verlaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt advances until he and Blade are nose to nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, Chief.  Can you blush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense beat.  Then Blade flashes a broad smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you want to play this game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade pulls out one of his silver stakes.  In response, t vampires reach for their weapons.  But Blade merely twirl around his fingers.  Then tosses it to Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been training two years to take me out.  Here I am, the big, bad vampire hunter.  So do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing, Blade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to be working as a unit, you people will be taking orders from me. (spreading his hands wide) So let's get it over with.  I'll give you a free shot, Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt looks to Nyssa, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you looking at her for?  You need permission?   I'm giving it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him, cabron!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade grabs Reinhardt's wrist, pulling the stake against chest, fixing the vampire with the deadliest of poker gaz

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Reinhardt?  You need a fucking manual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Reinhardt.  Do it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt tenses, thrusting the stake forward -- but Blad has already whirled out of the way, trapping his hand, th violently twisting it backwards. Before Reinhardt even knows what's happening, Blade swing him around into a headlock.  In his free hand he's got a tiny, barbed flechette.  The barbs spring open like a tic gripping mandibles as Blade drives the flechette into the base of Reinhardt's skull.  Reinhardt HOWLS in pain, but Blade just tightens his grip, choking off Reinhardt's air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up, Adolph, I just popped an explosive charge in the back of your head.  Silver nitrate.  Rigged to blow if anyone tampers with it.  I'll be keeping the detonator on me at all times.  You so much as look at me crosswise and I swear you'll be macking your girlfriend's pie with a fucking neck stump!  Got it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt lets loose a choked GRUNT.  Blade releases him, dropping the GASPING AUSTRIAN to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one says a word.

dialogues.speaker: WHISTLER
dialogues.text: Hefting a heavy ordnance case on the table.  Blade and company sit on one side, the Bloodpack on the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (opening a case of bullets) Glaser safety rounds in .38, .45, and 9mm caliber.  Foil capsules at the tip filled with silver nitrate grains.  They pack a major kinetic energy dump.  And since you suckheads don't like sunlight, we've modified the entry lights with UV filters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler flicks on the entry light.  Then notices that Ch isn't paying attention.  The vampire is looking at Snowma who is saying something in sign-language.  Chupa snickers Whistler picks up a massive gun with a modified C-mag (hundred round cylindrical mag).  It has a strange electr assembly barrel with shockwave ports running along it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This puppy here?  Hyper-velocity railgun.  Spits up silver-tipped iron core needles at six thousand butt humping feet per second.  Like this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler FIRES -- BA-BANG!  A SONIC BOOM rocks the worksh SHATTERING a number of windows and computer monitor scree as a wad of needle rushes just millimeters past Chupa's f embedding in the wall behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey!  The fuck you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting your attention, Paco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you've got it, warmblood.  Now what the fuck are you gonna do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade clears his throat and stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you girls are finished flirting, I'd like to get started.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Blade, Whistler, and the Bloodpack are silently suiting u for war -- strapping on body armor, securing stakes and knives, CLICKING ammo cartridges into their various weapo We SEE them lacing up combat boots, checking rifle sights entry lights.  Blade dons one of his EDTA pneumatic gauntlets.  Whistler loads custom rounds into a shotgun. Then he reaches to clip on an ammo vest.  But his hands a shaking slightly and he can't seem to clip the locking mechanism together.  After a beat, Blade reaches over and does it for Whistler.  Like a son helping his father.  A passes between them, Whistler and Blade looking at one another.  Then Whistler nods, satisfied. As Blade crosses towards Asad and Nyssa, he stops by Verlaine, sizing her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I kill you already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cold) That was my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.  Blade smiles coldly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This the part where you beat your chest and vow revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for the director's cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade moves on, stopping before Nyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where to first?

dialogues.text: Blade looks to the culvert in question.  He pulls back on the sectioned covers.  The opening is about two feet wide just large enough for a man to gain access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade drops into the sewer line.  The area is claustropho damp.  There are torn pieces of insulation hanging from t ceiling, saturated and dripping with blood. Blade crouch-walks further in.  We hear WIND.  He shines FLASHLIGHT.  A portion of the brick wall looks like it's clawed open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling down) Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade retreats back to the drain-pipe, pulling himself ba up.  We HOLD for a beat, then drift up to the blood-satur strips of insulation.  SOMEONE is crouched in the shadows there, clinging to the ceiling upside down. It's NOMAK, red-eyes shining in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in a previously unseen portion of Damaskino's vast bedroom.  An elegantly tiled pool area has been partition off by a series of latticed screens.  In the counterpoint this are a series of muted monitors tuned to the pulse of world -- CNN, MSNBC, C-SPAN, etc. Damaskinos sits in a robe, finishing a meal, his eyes flicking over the monitors -- tracking current events, ma fluctuations.  We get the sense that the man is a true polymath.  That he owes his five thousand-plus years of existence to resourcefulness rather than luck. Stevens enters, waiting to be acknowledged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) They've made contact with the Reapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) Any casualties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) Two so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unconcerned, Damaskinos slices into a piece of raw meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reverting to English) An inevitability, I suppose.  Nyssa was not among them, I trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  This is a dangerous game, you're playing, Damaskinos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any game worthy of being played is.  One must be patient.  In this way, I have outlived my enemies.  All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos steps beyond the screens now, into the pool ar and although we can't see the water from this angle, we c see patterns of ruby light flickering off the tiled walls Stevens follows, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade's too volatile.  You're not going to be able to keep manipulating him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos steps into the steaming liquid, which we now s is BLOOD.  His robe spreads out, floating on the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You worry too much, Stevens.  I have assurance from our friend inside that events are unfolding as scripted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As scripted?  You've already lost two of your own.  How many more are you willing to sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos sinks until he's waist-deep in the crimson flu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As many as it takes. (pointing) Do you see that jar over there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevens looks to a shelf where a gold and crystal Coptic rests.  A HUMAN HEART floats within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It contains my human heart -- (touching a pale scar on his chest) Something I relinquished a long time ago.  Only a fool would appeal to it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dying Reaper has now been chained inside the cell.  I WHEEZES and MOANS, clearly in agony.  Blade and Nyssa sta watch.  Blade grips the Reaper beneath its jaw, turning i face towards us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Recognize him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding) From the surveillance footage in the bloodbank.  He was one of the guard's Nomak attacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means he turned about seventy-two hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  So why is he dying?  He doesn't appear to have any broken bones, no entry wounds of any kind -- what's killing him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade nicks the Reaper's carotid artery with a knife.  CL SERUM oozes out, no red blood cells at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No hemoglobin left. Their metabolisms are too fast.  They burn out.  That's why they're having to feed so often.  Their systems are self destructing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If that's true, what about Nomak?  He's been alive longer than the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak's different.  He's the carrier. (shaking his head) There's something driving him beyond the Thirst.  Something we're missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they watch, the Reaper shakes through its final death throes, then grows still, the nictomembranes over its eye slowly sliding down.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: A pair of GLOVED HANDS spreads apart the Reaper's eyelids In response, the protective nictomembrane slides mechanic down over the pupil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appear to have a nictating membrane here, like you'd see on a crocodile or camel.  Shields the eyes from sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hands now part the Reaper's mouth, probing the seam i the chin, then splitting the mandible apart to reveal the enlarged esophagus.  The fingers push back on the gums an the pressure-sensitive fangs extend even further in respo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bifurcated mandible.  More developed masseter muscles and zygomatic bones around the mouth allowing for a much larger, stronger bite --

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK TO REVEAL
dialogues.text: Blade, Nyssa, and Scud are gathered around the autopsy ta The rest of the crew linger further back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epidermal layers are thicker, tougher --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa begins the Y-incision along the chest.  Once again, CLEAR SERUM oozes out.  She cracks open the thoracic cavi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ho-lee shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE inside the abdominal cavity.  A complex, pinkish/g parasitic organism has taken over every organ visible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never seen anything like this.  The Reapers are as different from us as we are from you. (probing the organism) It's almost as if the virus is re-wiring their bodies, creating new, parasitic organs which consume the old ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like cancer with a purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  Look at the digestive system. It's been drastically simplified.  Super charged.  And this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls back the lungs -- a calcified structure encasin fibrous mass rests where the heart would normally be.  Sh taps the calcified structure with a scalpel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heart is completely encased in bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to cut into the bony shell and the scalpel snap Scud WHISTLES, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck getting a stake through that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade studies the Reaper corpse, then looks to the Bloodp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got six hours till sunrise.  Be ready by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens at sunrise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take up the hunt again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta be fucking joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've seen what we're up against. Daylight's the only advantage we've got. They'll be more vulnerable then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) And so will we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I care about the humans who are dying, not you, got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snarling) Spare me the race card, OJ.  We're not going out into the sun.  It's too risky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a choice.  You're just going to have to protect yourselves as best you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade spins and leaves.  Whistler follows.  Nyssa watches them disappear into Blade's room.  Reinhardt and the othe vampires approach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You buying any of this chocolate Elvis bullshit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa just stares him down, obviously conflicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy doesn't know what the fuck he's doing.  We already lost Priest and Lighthammer, who's gonna be next?  Fuck him.  Fuck his rules.  First chance I get, I'm chowing down on that fucking HeeHaw sidekick of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snowman signs something to Verlaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think, Asad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) I don't think.  I follow orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asad looks to Nyssa once more -- perhaps he's even concer now.  She's still staring in the direction Blade left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade sits in the shadows, wrapping a piece of rubber tub around his arm, injecting himself with pneumatic syringe serum.  He shivers, convulses violently, then throws back head in relief.  When he does so, he SEES -- Whistler standing in the doorway.  They eye each other a moment as Blade unwraps the tubing from his arm, puts awa his syringe and serum.  Whistler lights a cigarette, then nods through a window towards Nyssa and the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask me, you and Miss Muffet are getting a mite too cozy for my taste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade moves to walk away, but Whistler stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am worrying.  Seems to me, you're starting to get confused as to which side of the line you're standing on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty hollow words coming from a man who spent the last year running with the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means I'm starting to wonder if the vampires still have their hooks in you. You've been acting strange ever since I gave you the cure.  Reckless, quick to anger -- (beat) You said it yourself, Whistler.  Those vampires knew our defense system backwards and forwards.  Where'd they get their intel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler steps closer, his voice dropping to a lethal, whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm compromised?!  Me?!  I'm not the one playing stink-finger with Vampirella out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade stares back at Whistler, calm as a viper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of line, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two comrades in arms stare each other down.  Then, finally, Whistler backs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler turns and strides exits.  We HOLD ON Blade, torn conflicted, watching Whistler retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE a FIGURE emerge from the shadows -- CHUPA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa walks the night, scanning shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like heat-vision, only tinged with crimson.  There are DR DEALERS and bottom feeding WHORES trolling for tricks out here, BEATING HEARTS and BRANCHING ARTERIES highlighted o their ghostly silhouettes. Chupa moves to the mouth of an alley, nodding to a DEALER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' to get hooked up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the dealer glances around to see if anyone's watching

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horse, Hawaiian ice.  Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa sniffs the air, glancing at a pulsating vein on the dealer's neck, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, huh?  Well I'm all off the hook on that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa steps into the alley with the dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's it gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa is at the dealer's throat before he can finish, flashing his fangs, shoving him backwards.  Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like a little adrenaline chaser.

dialogues.speaker: WHAP
dialogues.text: Grabs a fistful of Chupa's hair, jerking his head back. Blade.  He yanks Chupa off the dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying to feed, puto baboso!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dealer takes off as Blade swings Chupa around.  They exchange a couple of blows, then Blade knees him in the balls, twisting him around by his arm, dislocating it. Blade releases Chupa, shoving him forward.  Chupa's broke arm dangles awkwardly.  Furious, Chupa reaches for his .4 with his good hand -- only to hear the CLICK of another g as it's placed against the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: NYSSA
dialogues.text: Standing behind him, looking grim and determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it and you die. (Chupa considers options) You heard Asad.  Until this is over, these people are our allies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I haven't forgotten about Asad.  I'm just wondering if you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa re-holsters his gun, then jams his dislocated arm u against the wall and resets it.  He backs away.  Nyssa watches him leave, looks to Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right about one thing.  We do have to survive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to hunt to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  What are we supposed to do, then?  Starve ourselves because we fee on others in order to live?  What about that scumbag you just let off the hook? A nothing.  A drug-dealer.  How do you justify saving people like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade doesn't answer, just moves away.  She follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the Thirst better than any of us.  You're barely managing to tread water yourself.  Living in a constant state of pain, having to shoot up that serum of yours.  That's not what I call surviving, Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Blade's stony expression we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of the workshop.  Scud takes a hit of weed then resumes working on one of the UV entry lights -- it's bee taken half-apart and tweaked-out with cables and a crysta prism.  Whistler is there too, loading magazines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (observing Scud) The hell are you fiddling with there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proud, succinct) Tweaked the phosphor rod, modified the collimated beam, wanna concentrate the light, get something like a UV laser going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) You're wasting your time, already been tried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you didn't have the Scudster working on it, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (testy) Nope.  Back then we did not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unfazed) So how long have you known Blade, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going on twenty years now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade doesn't talk about the old days much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade doesn't talk about anything much. (nodding to Scud) What about you, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud pulls up his T-shirt.  His abdomen is covered in a network of horrific scars.  Like something you'd see on t survivor of a shark attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was backpacking.  Hooked up with these two chicks who were off to see the Burning Man festival.  We were gonna take "E", have ourselves a little freeball out in the desert.  You know the riff, "Dear Penthouse, I never thought this would happen to me, but --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud takes a Phillip and adjust some screws on the laser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, halfway through our Three's Company marathon, Janet and Chrissy started taking chunks out of me.  Woulda died too if Blade hadn't shown up and staked those mamacitas a new honeyhole. (shrugging) Things kinda fell in place after that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud jiggles the necklace of fangs around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Took myself a few souvenirs, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud triggers the modified entry light.  The light PULSES like a series of flash-bulbs going off, creating a stroboscopic effect as a wafer-thin, super-concentrated B BEAM OF LIGHT slices through the shadows.  Scud looks to Whistler and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm-mmm.  Poppa's got a brand new bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the shadowed skyline of monolithic buildings, the night is beginning to give way to dawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud stands before the others.  He looks bleary-eyed but pleased with the night's work.  The fruit of their effort are laid on a work table before them -- a half-dozen UV l guns, along with a collection of UV flashbang grenades an much bigger explosive device secured into a backpack carr Blade picks up one of the UV lasers.  He sights down the length of it.  Scud takes a power pack and slaps into the base of Blade's gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powerpacks have a limited charge, maybe ten minutes of continuous use at most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa gestures to the flashbang grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UV flashbang grenades with plug-in phosphor sticks -- (pointing to a backpack carrier) This is for the grand finale.  Wired together a couple-dozen of those puppies.  But I'd be careful where you pop your load.  Might end up frying yourselves in the process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?  You're not coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After last night?  Dude, I'm a lover, not a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asad looks to Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What good is all this firepower if we don't know where they're hiding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We won't need to.  They'll come to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade looks to Nyssa, who tosses Reinhardt an aerosol cannister.  He sprays a little, then wrinkles his nose in disgust, gagging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fucking foul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're pheromones.  I infused them from that Reaper's adrenal glands.  All mammals use them to mark their territory.  Even vampires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that!  I'm not spraying some gash hound's nut-juice on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, the Reapers will key to it. If we use this, we'll draw them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the ballroom gratings.  A high-angle shot looking down at the octagonal iron culvert around which Blade, Whistler, and the remainder of the Bloodpack are gathered The mechanized, sectional portions of the culvert coverin are GRINDING UPWARD, flowering open and apart like some b and rust-encrusted gateway to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, the group of hunters descend into the claustrophobic chamber.  Verlaine is lugs the UV bomb on back.  Blade leads them to the clawed-open portion of the brick wall, then on through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade leads the group along a grime-encrusted line which slopes gradually downward, sloshing through ankle-deep ru off water collected from the city above them.  Tendrils o mist drift about, cutting their field of vision even furt Here and there, thin SHAFTS of SUNLIGHT cut down through cracks in the street above, requiring the vampires to cautiously circumvent them. They reach a four-way intersection of tunnels.  Blade pau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for Nyssa's pheromones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade opens a statchel.  Inside are a dozen distinctive aluminum atomizers.  He hands them out to the others. Whistler triggers a can, spraying a thin mist over his fa wrinkling his noses in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eau de suckhead.  Tasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll split into three units.  First team that makes contact wins the prize. Try to maintain radio silence from here on out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade points to Chupa and Whistler, indicating the Easter tunnel.  They head off.  Next, Blade directs Nyssa, Asad, Snowman, and Verlaine down the Western tunnel.  Blade nod Reinhardt and starts down the Northern branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's darker here, no shafts of sunlight slicing down from above.  Whistler turns on his UV entry light.  Chupa reac out with his hand, partially blocking the beam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the shifting patterns of light and shadow play across Chupa's face we SEE his pupils contract and dilate unnaturally large in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to attract them, not scare them off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but you fangs can see in the dark. What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa tosses Whistler a pair of night-vision goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bifocals, grandpa.  And try to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa heads into the darkness, moving with uncanny speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We intercut between the three teams now, back and forth a they progress deeper into the city's bowels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Reinhardt trudge along.  The tunnel slopes inwa forming a V-shaped channel where a trickle of water flows Blade notices SOMETHING bobbing in the water.  He nudges with his foot and knocks it free.  It's a broken HUMAN TI which twirls around, then flows past their legs. A few steps later on, Reinhardt notices SOMETHING ELSE. stoops into waist-deep water, picking up what he thinks i isolated HUMAN RIB -- but ends up snagging a tangled mass hair, mud, and bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler and Chupa move side by side.  Chupa is anxious, darting about.  Occasionally, they come upon a transectio with smaller conduits leading off to the right and the le Then they reach a stooped, narrower tunnel and have to mo single file. Suddenly, a BLAST of LIGHT and THUNDEROUS SOUND explodes above them.  They look up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A subway TRAIN rockets by on a track just above them, pummeling them with soot and dust. Unseen by them, briefly illuminated by the flashing subwa lights we see three Reaper faces, pale and haunting, hang upside down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Reinhardt reach a dead-end where the tunnel has caved in.  A BERM OF HUMAN BONES slopes upward from the w -- skulls and ribs, vertebrae, tibias, metatarsi.  Blade kneels, inspecting them.  There are gnaw marks on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be hundreds of these skeletons here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I think you people may have underestimated how many Reapers you're dealing with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nyssa, Snowman, Verlaine, and Asad cautiously move forward, Nyssa GASPS, startled by -- HALF A DOZEN REAPERS laying on the tunnel floor before th in a stagnant pool of sewage water.  Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Whistler and Chupa, Whistler is in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey,hillbilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Whistler turns around, Chupa SLAMS Whistler in the sid the head, swiping his night-vision goggles off.  As Whist vainly searches for his goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't nobody here but you and me, chicken wing.  I'd say this is as good a time as any to settle up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chupa moves stealthily in darkness, violently KICKING the older man.  Whistler tries to crawl away, then reaches fo his pheromone atomizer and locks it in the "on-position". Chupa continues to lay into Whistler we SEE the atomizer away, dispensing its contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade and Reinhardt by the berm of human bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered; over comm.) Blade.  We've got six Reapers.  They're all dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa nods to Asad and Verlaine.  They train their UV las on the area where the Reaper corpses were -- but the Reap bodies are gone.  And so is Snowman for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Where did they go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw that, where did Snowman go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, we hear a NOISE from above.  Nyssa and the oth whip their UV lasers in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, they were playing possum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HORDE OF REAPERS skitter away from the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the pheromone atomizer, the spray petering out. Whistler is beat to shit, bleeding from his mouth.  Chupa reaches for his handgun, whipping it out just as -- Whistler's hands brush the damaged night vision goggles. swings them upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler has just enough time to register Chupa, the hand pointed directly at him/us before noticing SOMETHING ELSE just beyond Chupa.

dialogues.speaker: A DOZEN REAPERS
dialogues.text: Clinging to the ceiling above.  They drop down on Chupa l a pack of rabid dogs, literally tearing him in half.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing GUNFIRE and SCREAMS, Blade charges back in Whistl direction as --

dialogues.speaker: THE BERM OF HUMAN BONES
dialogues.text: EXPLODE apart.  Reapers CHARGE towards them, hitting Blad the chest, driving him backwards.  As Blade falls, his en light swings upward, illuminating.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER REAPER
dialogues.text: Drops down atop Reinhardt, knocking his UV gun into the water.  We SEE even MORE REAPERS converging in on them fr the side tunnels in a cacophony of SHADOW and NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verlaine, Nyssa and Asad are FIRING their UV lasers.  The pumping flashes of their guns throw crazy shadows in ever direction.  Adding to the unbridled chaos of strobing lig and NOISE.  More and more Reapers are swarming towards th moving towards us at an unearthly clip!  Nyssa and her compatriots retreat, running for their lives.

dialogues.speaker: A REAPER
dialogues.text: Leaps, landing on Verlaine's back.  It grabs her head and deftly SNAPS her spine in half with a sickening CRUNCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler panics, backing away from the SOUNDS of the reap slaughtering Chupa.  He finds his gun, flicks on the UV e light -- And just like that, the attacking reapers have vanished. Whistler whirls about, sweeping the UV beam around, but a he SEES is darkness. Then, a bone-chilling WHISPER cuts through the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler spins.  NOMAK RIGHT BEHIND HIM.  As Whistler whi the UV gun up, Nomak stops it.  The beam is mere millimet from the Reaper's face -- close enough to illuminate his nightmarish features, but not close enough to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you survive this, tell your master. My end is my beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an eyeblink, Nomak is gone.  Whistler spins, shining t UV this way and that.  Alone in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade FIRES his UV into a Reaper's torso.  As the Reaper incinerates, Blade spins, FIRING at a second Reaper --

dialogues.speaker: ON REINHARDT
dialogues.text: Firing his non-UV weapon.  Two Reapers are closing in on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade throws Reinhardt his UV laser and unsheathes his sw Reinhardt sweeps the lethal beam over the two reapers. Blade retreats back into the water, calm, letting the creatures comes to him.  As they close in on him, he slip the tip of the sword beneath the surface of the water, waiting -- As one, the Reapers converge on Blade.  He swings his swo up from the water, hacking away at them, using their own momentum against them. Reinhardt considers his options.  He decides to run for i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt races away, abandoning Blade.  Blade reaches fo one of the UV flashbangs clipped to his harness.  He pull the pin with his teeth and shoves it into an on-rushing Reaper's mouth as -- Reinhardt slips on the wet concrete and -- BANG!  Searing LIGHT fills the tunnel, instantly incinera the Reaper. Reinhardt's unprotected face CATCHES FIRE.   He SCREAMS, falling back into the water, trying to douse the flames. ANOTHER REAPER lands atop him, dragging him down as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear GUNFIRE and SCREAMS coming from all directions. Blade retreats.  A reaper, fully ON FIRE from the UV explosion, races towards him.  As Blade decapitates it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting into radio) Re-group!  Re-group!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asad and Nyssa also retreat.  Nyssa pulls a pin on a UV flashbang, throws it behind her.  BA-BANG!  UV light fill the tunnels and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade, Nyssa, Whistler and Asad abruptly find themselves in the four-way juncture, knee-deep in water.  They quick regroup, out of breath, riding adrenaline highs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Chupa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget him, he's chunk-style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same with Snowman and Verlaine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess that perfume of yours did the trick after all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) A little too well, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others turn to look in Blade's direction.

dialogues.speaker: DOZENS OF RED EYES
dialogues.text: are staring out at them from the darkness of the Eastern Tunnel.  Then we hear a HISSING SOUND coming from the opposite direction.  Blade and the others spin around --

dialogues.speaker: MORE RED-EYED REAPERS
dialogues.text: are closing in on them from the West.  AND THE NORTH.  AN THE SOUTH!  There must be forty of them in all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.  We got the whole fucking Partridge family here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They retreat until they are back to back, each one of the covering their respective tunnel opening.

dialogues.speaker: A REAPER
dialogues.text: Lunges at them from the North.  Asad triggers his UV lase scorching the creature.  It HOWLS and slinks backwards.

dialogues.speaker: TWO MORE REAPERS
dialogues.text: Attack from the East and the West.  Blade and Nyssa respo in kind, burning their assailants in mid-air.  But even a they fire, their UV beams weaken, the flashes of light co from their barrels pulsing less frequently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless anybody has any bright ideas, I'd say we're about half a battery away from a reaper gang-bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome are managing to keep the Reapers at bay, but just barely.  Blade motions to Nyssa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the rest of the pheromones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa reaches inside her harness, handing Blade the remai atomizers.  He crushes them in his fist, letting the flui within spill over his face and chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reapers become even more agitated, HISSING loudly, pressing in on them closer and closer.  Blade nods his he back down the Western tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verlaine's body is back there somewhere with the UV bomb.  If you train your guns in that direction, you'll drive an opening in their ranks.  I'll run for it.  When the Reapers come after me, you make a break for it the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asad studies Blade with newfound respect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hefting his UV gun) Then I'll die trying, won't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it.  I don't want to hear your words.  Let's do this NOW!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome spin, FIRING their UV lasers down the Wester tunnel.  The Reapers SHRIEK, falling to either side, thei bodies burning -- Blade CHARGES FORWARD, firing his dying UV laser.  As he makes it past the line of Reapers, they start after him, driven into a frenzy by the pheromones.  The Reapers in t Northern and Eastern tunnels flood after Blade too, leavi Nyssa, Whistler and Asad to contend with the Reapers in t Southern tunnel.  They discharge their weapons, shoulderi Reapers aside, making a mad dash for freedom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade runs, splashing and stumbling through the water, ju hair's breadth ahead of the HOWLING Reaper horde.  Sudden the tunnel widens out into a larger chamber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler and the others FIRE BACK at the small group of Reapers which have followed them, rather than Blade.

dialogues.speaker: ON WHISTLER
dialogues.text: cut off from Nyssa and Asad.  He spots a maintenance ladd and runs for it, dragging himself up the rungs.  A Reaper leaps up the ladder after him -- Whistler reaches the top of the ladder, but his exit is blocked by a manhole cover!  It's STUCK!  Whistler swings his shotgun, FIRING into the cover. The cover is BLOWN UPWARDS, sending a shaft of blinding sunlight down on the Reaper below him.  As the Reaper incinerates, Whistler scurries upwards to safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade reaches Verlaine's half-submerged body.  He tears t backpack carrier off the dead vampire and hefts it onto h shoulder, charging up an elevated concrete embankment as

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa and Asad find themselves cornered.  Their UV lasers shot.  The Reapers are closing in and we're --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back with Blade, the Reapers overrunning him.  They pile one another in a frenzied effort to get to him.  Dozens a dozens of them.  And still Blade struggles upward, liftin the UV cluster bomb triumphantly above his head, triggeri the device. The world goes white. No explosions.  Just BLINDING, PURIFYING LIGHT leaving us with a retina-burn image of Blade's silhouette surrounded Reapers.  In that brief instant, the Reapers are frozen, revealed as WRAITH-LIKE X-RAY IMAGES of bone and muscle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLAST-WAVE of LIGHT fills the tunnel, chasing its way towards Nyssa and Asad, overtaking the Reapers before the Asad throws himself at Nyssa, knocking her into the knee- water, shielding her body with his own.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE WATER
dialogues.text: Asad still burns, flaring up and disintegrating from the surface on downward like a piece of liquid-drenched magnesium, bubbles streaming from his writing body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness, then patterns of subtle shadow and light as our vision slowly returns.  FWASH!  Blade strikes a FLARE.  I the sputtering aureole, the aftermath is slowly revealed. Blade crouches, unscathed, as if he were standing ground in the aftermath of Hiroshima.  Scores of Reaper ash-outl radiate out from him, some of them flash-seared into the surrounding brickwork walls like permanent shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade slowly makes his way down the tunnel, using the sputtering flare to guide him.  As before, he sees nothin but Reaper ash outlines.  But then, Blade sees --

dialogues.speaker: NYSSA
dialogues.text: Bleeding and horribly burned despite Asad's sacrifice.  B crouches, scooping her up into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!  Blade kicks open a pair of doors, hurrying Nyssa inside.  He's carrying her limp form in his arms, having wrapped her in a blanket.  Blade himself looks like hell warmed over -- covered in blood, ash, and grime. He rushes her towards the ER, navigating through a maze o PATIENTS and VISITORS.  An ER NURSE approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you can't just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!  Blade shoulders the ER NURSE aside, barreling into triage where bewildered DOCTORS and ORDERLIES wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She needs a hypertransfusion.  NOW!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade sets Nyssa down on an operating table, pulling off blanket.  She's badly burned and she's lost an enormous amount of blood.  As we watch, she GROANS, revealing her fangs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aghast) God in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a POLICEMAN enters, gun drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, buddy, step away if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAP!  Blade slaps the cop's gun away and KICKS him in th chest.  The cop flies backwards, SLAMS into a bank of equipment, falls.  A NURSE SCREAMS.  In a near blur, Blad has his MACH out and pressed against the Doctor's forehea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not particularly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holstering his MACH) Then get your fucking team in gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade unsheathes his sword, deftly drawing the edge acros his wrist, opening a vein.  He cradles Nyssa's head, pull her mouth to the wound on his wrist.  And as she starts t feed we pull back and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun dips towards the horizon.  The shadows of the urb landscape lengthen and darken in time-lapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade stands beneath the showerhead, turning his face up the scalding spray, rinsing the blood from his chiseled physique.  Crimson water circles the drain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa now rests on a cot.  Peaceful, the color having somewhat returned to her features.  After a moment, her e flutter open and she takes in her surroundings.  She is i Blade's austere bedroom -- there are tatami mats, a basin water, a well-thumbed volume of Zen koans.

dialogues.speaker: A SHAFT OF SUNLIGHT
dialogues.text: cuts through an icy window pane above, angling down near Nyssa's cot.  Dust motes swirl about it. Nyssa focuses on it.  Longingly.  Then she raises her arm reaches towards it.  Closer, closer -- just barely extend her hand into the light.  Her fingertips blacken and smok yet Nyssa endures the pain for another moment.  Finally, withdraws her hand, inspecting the damage -- then notices Blade watching her from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each day is a little life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Each day is a little life.  Every waking and rising a little birth, every fresh morning a little youth, every going to rest and sleep a little death."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks back to the sunlight, wistful, sits herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade enters, kneeling by the edge of the cot, inspecting wounds.  Studiously avoiding her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would've been easy for you to let me die back there today, but you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) I wouldn't read too much into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for his face.  Blade stops her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because one of us is going to kill the other before this ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be like that.  We don't have to be enemies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get real.  I was useful to Damaskinos as long as the hunt was still on.  Now that it's over, all bets are off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointedly) If that's true, then why'd you save me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade stands now, moving to the ice-covered window, troub by the question.  Damned if he knows the answer.  After a beat, Nyssa rises too, keeping to the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you hate us so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am a hunter.  A weapon.  It's what I do.  It's in my blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well it's in mine, too.  I'm a pureblood.  I wasn't turned.  I was born this way.  Just like you.  Am I evil because I want to survive? (beat) What about a wolf?  What about any predator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa pursues Blade, circling around in front of him so h has to face her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only difference between you and me is that I made peace with who I was a long time ago.  I'm not ashamed of what I am. (beat) You haven't been hunting us all these years.  You've been hunting yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade moves away.  She reaches for his shoulder.  He whir on her, angry, traps her hand.  She tires to pull it free he grips her wrist tightly, pulling her closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're hurting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pain cuts the deepest, isn't that what you said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And closer, their faces are just inches apart now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reminds you you're alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Blade kisses her, hungrily.  Nyssa responds in kind. head drops low, her mouth finding the cords of his neck - sucking at his flesh, then sinking her teeth in deep and WHAM!  Blade clamps a hand around her throat, slamming he head back.  A droplet of blood dribbles from her lips as lets loose a breathless shudder.  She's in the ecstatic throes of the Thirst now, all reason gone. Blade reaches his other hand to her shirt, ripping it ope he runs his fingers across her breasts, then over her exp rib cage.  He turns her around, forcing her against the w sinking his own fangs into the back of her neck.  She gro as we --

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO OF THEM
dialogues.text: Naked on the tatami mats upon which Blade sleeps.  Skin beaded with sweat.  Breath steaming in the chill air.  He atop her, moving inside her with measured thrusts. Nyssa's limbs are wrapped around him.  She claws at the expanse of his back with her fingernails.  Her mouth is locked on Blade's throat, then his is locked on hers. Together they drink, leeching blood from one another.

dialogues.speaker: PULLING BACK AGAIN
dialogues.text: Nyssa clutching greedily at Blade like she never wants to go.  Her soul is gone -- transported to that place we dri to when the euphoria overtake us and we're somehow able t transcend the horror of our fleeting lives. Finally, Nyssa GASPS, climaxing as she retracts her fangs from Blade.  Her head rolls to the side as her pupil -- focused on nothing short of eternity -- dilate unnaturall large.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Blade and Nyssa lie in each other's arms, awash in moonli blissfully dead to the world until --

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING MAKES BLADE STIR
dialogues.text: He sits up, listening.  Nyssa stirs beside him.  She move speak but Blade holds up a hand, silencing her.  Together they slowly creep towards a nearby window where --

dialogues.speaker: JARED NOMAK'S NIGHTMARE FACE
dialogues.text: is pressed up against the icy glass, staring back at them Nyssa GASPS.  Blade draws back with a start.  But in the it takes to blink, Nomak is gone.  Just then, we hear a NOISE.  Scud appears in a doorway, groggy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was here.  Watching us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants us to know he's hunting us now.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Blade is at the computer workstation.  He activates the footage of Nomak he was viewing earlier.  He fast-forward a specific moment, then plays it back at normal speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak said something to me before he disappeared the first time --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade points to the screen, saying the words as Nomak silently mouths them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Athelfiki singenia ex amato.  At first I thought he might've been using one of the vampire dialects.  But it turns out, it's Greek.  Do you know what it means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means "bloodbrother."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well maybe I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade spins, his MACH pistol up and ready to fire.  Whist sits on the opposite side of the room, watching them as h smokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Scud) Your security's for shit, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just out connecting a few dots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler rises from his chair.  He flicks his cigarette b into the shadows and fixes Blade with a heavy stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bangin' some vampire chick.  Kind of a faux pas in our line of work, wouldn't you say?  Hope you double bagged it, at least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade is still guarded, not yet ready to lower his MACH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your problem, Whistler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you ask your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade looks to Nyssa, but she seems equally perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did some checking on that Carter Stevens character.  That familiar of theirs who claimed he was with the NIH? Turns out he used to work for them, but he doesn't anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who does he work for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler gives Nyssa a rueful stare, then tosses Blade a research folder.  On the cover is the same red, double-he logo we saw at Damaskinos' facility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some biotech outfit called Caliban Industries.  They've been lying to us since day one.  This Nomak fucker didn't evolve.  He was designed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa look to Blade, imploring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect us to believe that? (to Blade) Who you going to trust, Blade?  Me or her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A high-tech, heavily guarded industrial complex nestled within an expanse of unassuming wooded acreage overlookin the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter Stevens shuts down his computer workstation, then moves to the heavy oak door, glancing at a medical chart he opens it.  When he looks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fist PUNCHES Stevens in the face.

dialogues.speaker: BLADE
dialogues.text: Stands in the entry way.  Whistler is behind him, holding gun to Nyssa.  Scud is there, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mobing in on Stevens) Start talking, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade spins Stevens around, shoving his face against a gl case, crushing the man's nose, spiderwebbing the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
