dialogues.text: Nomak!  You created him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade clamps his fingers around Stevens' broken nose and twists it with a sickening CRUNCH.  Stevens SCREAMS, cavi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohgodohgodohgod... (in agony) Alright, alright.  Yes, we did... (gasping) PLEASE!  PLEASE!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade releases him.  Stevens sinks to the floor, cradling brutalized face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking, Stevens.  Tell me why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sputtering) The Shadow Cabinet.  For decades they've been trying to find a way to rid themselves of their hereditary weaknesses.  Viral epidemiology, immunochemistry.  Recombinant DNA was the next logical step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (genuinely horrified) No, that's not possible.  They wouldn't keep something like this from me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father didn't want you to know. (haltingly) Something went wrong.  The Reaper strain was too aggressive.  Then Nomak escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're supposed to clean up your mess.  Fucking perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) Look, the fact that Nomak was artificially created didn't make the threat any less urgent.  He was still out there, spreading the Reaper virus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Blade's not concerned about that now.  He's got somet more pressing on his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The genetic material you spliced into Nomak -- (beat; almost fearful) Where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should think that would be obvious at this point.

dialogues.speaker: DAMASKINOS
dialogues.text: Standing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took the genetic material from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos leads them down a corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jared Nomak is your genetic brother. And I suppose if you follow that line of reasoning to its logical conclusion, then these are your offspring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos reaches to a nearby control panel, pressing a button.  A pair of massive doors slide apart, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: THE EUGENICS CHAMBER
dialogues.text: We are in a vast, multitiered, temperature-controlled cha -- equal parts 21st century medical facility and Hammer H of Horror. A network of catwalks look down upon the circular chamber the center of which is dominated by a massive, steel cask which is in turn ringed by a safety railing.  The operati looks not unlike a small-scale water purification plant, perhaps a futuristic distillery.  Only in this instance, liquid churning within the cask is HUMAN BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: TINY EMBRYOS
dialogues.text: Each no bigger than a thumbnail, line the walls of the chamber, preserved in credit card sized cryo-cases.  Ther are thousands of them, resting atop one another in racks stretch from the floor on upwards. As Damaskinos removes an embryo from the rack, we see ANO EMBRYO behind it.  That cryo-case now slides forward with WHIR, taking the place of the one which Damaskinos remove Like some kind of perverse vending machine.  God knows ho deep they're stacked.  If thousands are visible, there co be tens of thousands in total. Damaskinos holds the translucent cryo-case up to the ligh The Embryo within shudders, its tiny heart beating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) A new breed, begotten from your own flesh.  Immune to silver, even sunlight. (stepping towards Blade) The wolves have lain with the sheep long enough.  No more compromises.  No more deals.  Only closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!  We hear the tread of HEAVY FOOTSTEPS approaching. eyes turn towards a side corridor.

dialogues.speaker: REINHARDT
dialogues.text: enters from the shadows, holding Scud's rail-gun.  Much o his face has been burnt away, leaving him with a ghastly death's head mask of blackened muscle and exposed bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put it back in park, Blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you were dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like there's a lot of that going around these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reinhardt aims the rail gun at Blade, a DOZEN VAMPIRE GUARDS appear on the catwalks above, also taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-thousand feet per second, isn't that what Whistler said?  Let's see you dodge this one --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade does his level best, pulling his MACH, squeezing of SHOT even as Reinhardt FIRES.  BA-BANG!  Blade is hit in side, spun clear around.  His shot goes wild, hitting one the Guards in the head, turning him to ash as Blade himse falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade GASPS in shock.  The rail-gun needles have ripped a brutal hole through the side of his chest-plate.  He clut at his flank, trying to staunch the blood that's seeping between his fingers.  As he sits forward, we see MORE FLECHETTES have embedded in the wall behind him, having t completely through him. Whistler steps forward.  One of the vampire sentries LASH OUT, striking him in the face with the butt of his rifle. Whistler sinks to his knees, stunned.  The guard disarms

dialogues.speaker: ON BLADE
dialogues.text: Gritting his teeth against the pain.  He reaches inside h combat harness, pulling out the remote detonator for the explosive flechette in Reinhardt's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss your ass goodbye, Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wasting your time, Blade.  The flechette's a dud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud crosses over to Reinhardt's side.  Whistler stares a him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was never supposed to explode.  All it was supposed to do was make you feel like you were in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade's eyes darken with hatred.  Reinhardt laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you had me on a short leash, didn't you, chief?  Only it turns out, you're the one that's been on the leash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt digs his claws into his scalp and tugs the barb flechette from his skull.  As he does so, Blade's remote detonator BEEPS to indicate it's being tempered with. Reinhardt finishes removing it and sighs contentedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt tosses the fletchette to Scud, who grins, flipp down his lower lip to reveal a vampire glyph tattooed on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I'm one of Damaskinos' familiars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade looks to Nyssa who averts her gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, your little cootchie knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You little shit.  When did they get to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back when Blade had me hunting down your puckered old ass.  What's up with your hair, anyway?  Fucking Willie Nelson look-a-like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud punches Whistler in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I so wanted to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud shakes his hand, which is smarting from the blow.  H looks to Blade now, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you.  You never cared about me.  I gave you everything.  All you cared about was digging up the old fuck!  You think they scoped out my security system? (chuckling) I let them in.  Dude, I practically gave 'em the fucking keys.  I've been feeding Damaskinos information the whole time. Providing them with samples of your genetic material -- helping them with the Reaper program.  They're close, Blade.  Right up against it.  Any day now, they're all going to be Daywalkers. And when that happens, well, let's just say, I don't want to be on the losing team.  You may be strong, you may be fast, but in the end, you're just too human, B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pinches Blade's cheek.  Then he stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's down and dirty.  Got anything to say for yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak, but defiant) Two things.  One, I was on to you the moment they turned you.  And two -- (raising the detonator; smiling) I switched that dud of yours back with the real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scud has a split-second of terrified, wide-eyed realizati before Blade pushes the button and BOOM!  The flechette i Scud's hand EXPLODES, blowing his body apart, spraying th nearest him with blood.  Primarily Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the others react with varying degrees of surprise and horror, Reinhardt savagely KICKS Blade across the face. HITS Blade again and again, driving him down to the floor Then he bends and tugs the sword from Blade's back-scabba preparing to cut his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt hesitates.  Nyssa takes a step towards Blade, b Damaskinos stops her.  Damaskinos gestures to his guards. They haul Blade up and drag him from the lab.  Reinhardt gestures to Whistler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him, then? (crossing to Whistler, handcuffing him) Me and Hobo Kelly here have a little unfinished business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos waves dismissively.  Reinhardt takes Whistler away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade is dragged into a large autopsy room.  The vampire guards lay him on a steel autopsy table.  He struggles against them, but he's just too weak from loss of blood. Eventually they get him secured, clamping his wrists and ankles into steel manacles which are affixed to the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade's sword pommel as the booby-trap blades in the hand spring out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal Reinhardt holding Blade's sword.  He gives it a few practiced swings, then runs his thumb alon the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many vampires do you think he's killed with this thing?

dialogues.speaker: ON WHISTLER
dialogues.text: Sitting in the corner, his hands cuffed behind his back. are in a security station filled with surveillance monito offering various views of the laboratory complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not nearly enough, Fritz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking, warmblood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt KICKS Whistler in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm through with you, you'll be begging for a dirt nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler spits blood and glares up at Reinhardt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been dead before.  Didn't much cotton to it.  Tell you what, chicken shit.  You do your worst.  We'll settle up after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa stands before the banks of vampire embryos, clearly troubled.  Damaskinos regards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) My child --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos moves in close to her, running a finger along throat.  She doesn't acknowledge it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English) I would hate to think you were losing your perspective.  Who do you think God favors in the web?  The spider or the fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak said something to Blade in Greek. Athelfiki singenia ex amato.  Where did he learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From his father, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified) You experimented on your own, son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos slowly tightens his hand around Nyssa's throat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have fathered thousands of children in centuries since I first walked this earth.  Make no mistake, Nyssa.  Those blood-ties mean nothing to me when measured against the ascendancy of our race.  Nothing. (giving her an extra squeeze) If you have any interest in remaining alive, you would do well to remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos releases Nyssa.  She falls, GASPING for breath He stares down at her with disdain, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos enters, followed by Carter Stevens.  The guard remain posted at the main entrance of the room.  Damaskin approaches, looking down at Blade. Blade stares back at him, still defiant, but fighting a losing battle.  He's dying and he knows it.  His breathin shallow.  It's an effort just to keep his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every century, humans become more repulsive to me.  Once, you were souls to be taken, corrupted.  But you have disgraced yourselves to being nothing more than blood and meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SURGEONS snap on surgical gloves.  Stevens is enjoyin seeing Blade helpless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to harvest you, Blade. (injecting fluid into Blade) Bone marrow, organs, everything.  Your tissue's too valuable to let go to waste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Nomak is still out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True, but thanks to you, we know his weakness.  We can keep him contained. It's just a matter of time before we hunt him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad you're out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos is amused by Blade's seeming lack of concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge.  That's what Nomak wanted all along.  To pay back the people who created him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be right.  Fortunately for us, he has no idea where this facility is located.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade smiles, laughing tiredly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does now. (off their concerned looks) He's been watching me since the tunnels. Following me.  I led him right to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade lifts up his hand, unfurling his previously closed fist.  There is a deep gash in his palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like a trail of bread crumbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos stares at Blade's hand, then looks to the floo A line of blood droplets lead back to the doors through w he entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various hallways, the helipad outside Caliban industries, etc.  In rapid succession, we SEE more TRAILS OF BLOOD DROPLETS.  Then, just as quickly, we are back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Damaskinos and company.  Suddenly, the lights above flicker then go out.  As emergency lights kick on -- BANG!  BANG!BANG!BANG!  All eyes turn towards a steel security door which is shuddering -- bulging and bending inwards as Nomak throws himself against it. Damaskinos looks to a bank of security monitors which are flickering back to life now.  We see Nomak's blurred silhouette from various angles, pummeling the door.  Then RIPPPPPP!!!  A portion of the door is clawed open and we a glimpse of Nomak's SNARLING FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (roaring) FATHER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos' eyes widen in terror as he stumbles backwards activating an ALARM.  He looks to the guards, SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos runs for his life, rushing out the opposite do quickly followed by Stevens as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa hears the ALARMS and moves into a corridor lit by r strobing emergency lights.  VAMPIRE GUARDS are rushing pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reinhardt also hears the ALARMS.  He looks to the surveillance monitors where he SEES Nomak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, we see Whistler taking advantage of the distraction.  He folds his legs up under him, working his cuffed hands over his feet.  When Reinhardt spins back aw from the security monitors -- Whistler is GONE.  A steel grating in the floor lies half open.  The obvious means of exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Nomak continues tearing down the autopsy door, BULLETS hammer into his back.  He turns, sees a DOZEN GUARDS FIRI at him, their gunfire chewing the shit out of the concret walls around him.  Nomak staggers, but doesn't go down as CLEAR BLOOD sprays from the body hits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whistler shuffles forward through the narrow conduit on h elbows.  We hear footsteps.  Through the metal gratings above, we glimpse TWO FIGURES rushing past --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos and Stevens round a corner, spilling into seve GUARDS.  He shoves his fellow vampires aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a grate moving up from the floor.  Whistler emer rushing to Blade's side.  As he starts frantically releas Blade from his bonds, he looks to the ravaged door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak savages the guards, flinging them into the air.  A guard's body hits the V-gap in the door and obscures our as -- Whistler redoubles his efforts, finally freeing Blade.  H helps him from the autopsy table.  Blade is sinking, star to fade.  Whistler slaps his face, shaking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Blade.  Talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carnage.  A frazetta painting come to life.  Nomak atop d guards, draining the last of his victims' blood.  He whip his face in our direction and ROARS, charging the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!  The door gives way and Nomak enters.  To the right SEES Whistler and Blade exiting.  To the left, he SEES th security monitors.  Damaskinos and Stevens can be glimpse one of these monitors. Nomak moves to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blade clutches his bleeding side, staggering down the corridor towards a door marked "Eugenics" with Whistler's help.  By all rights, Blade should be dead.  But he conti on, moving towards the door with determination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a hand twisting a safety lever on the floor.  PU BACK to reveal Stevens manually activating a series of hydraulic lock-down latches. CHINK!CHINK!CHINK!  The doors of the Eastern, Northern, a Western corridors are sealing, lock-down latches clamping down for extra security.  Even as the Western door seals, glimpse Nomak rushing towards it with inhuman speed.

dialogues.speaker: ON STEVENS
dialogues.text: panicked, turning towards the open elevator cab where --

dialogues.speaker: DAMASKINOS
dialogues.text: is waiting.  But even as Stevens starts towards the eleva Damaskinos dispassionately presses the "CLOSE DOOR" butto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stevens rushes towards the closing elevator doors, but it too late.  He pounds his fist against them.  Behind him, hear a terrible RENDING OF METAL as the Western door give Stevens looks in that direction -- In an eyeblink, Nomak is upon him, SLAMMING his hand over Stevens' face, crushing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Damaskinos slides a security card through a reader and punches in a code, a thin SPRAY OF BLOOD jets across his forearm.  He looks to the elevator doors.  The spray of b is coming through the vertical door seal.  The metal door SHUDDER violently and then the cab begins to ascend. Damaskinos retreats to the far corner of the elevator, breathing a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH!  A pneumatic door slides open.  Blade and Whistle enter.  They are on the second level now, up amongst the catwalks.  Below them is the churning cask of purified bl They have almost reached the end of the catwalk when --

dialogues.speaker: REINHARDT AND HIS MEN
dialogues.text: converge on the lab from two directions at once.  Some of vampires spill through the door on the second level with Reinhardt, while others enter on the ground floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop him!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reinhardt takes aim at Blade with the shotgun, the oth vampires FIRE.  Whistler is HIT in the leg.  He goes down CRYING OUT, then grips Blade's arm, shoving him onward --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO!!!

dialogues.speaker: ON BLADE
dialogues.text: gripping the guard rail for support, dragging himself alo Reinhardt fires.  A SHOTGUN BLAST hits Blade, grazing him otherwise missing him.  As Reinhardt curses and prepares fire again -- Blade makes it to the end of the catwalk, pitching himsel out into open space.  Time slows to a crawl as Blade tumb downward, plummeting into --

dialogues.speaker: THE BLOOD CASK BELOW
dialogues.text: Blade sinks from view, disappearing beneath the churning slurry of crimson.  A beat passes as Reinhardt and his me draw closer, apprehensive.  Then, an explosion of BLOOD gushes over Reinhardt and the others.  They fall backward blinded, slipping --

dialogues.speaker: BLADE
dialogues.text: surfaces from the cask in morbidly glorious slow-motion. Think of Sheen in the end-sequence of Apocalypse Now, onl instead of a river of mud, Blade is covered head-to-toe i crimson.  Majestic and glistening.  A primordial god.  He rears back his head, letting loose a triumphal ROAR. Reinhardt's men hesitate.  One look at Blade's eyes and w can see he's tapped into a well-spring of fury even he ne knew he had.  The man is super-charged and ready for war. Blade tears into the vampires, unleashing a blizzard of martial arts moves.  He powers a right hook into the firs vampire's face, then pivots, launching a devastating spin back-fist into the face of a second.  At the same time, h rips the second guard's security belt from his waist, twirling it around nanchadku-style to blind a third guard capture the wrist of a fourth. Some vampires FIRE their guns, but Blade is a whirlwind, shifting and dodging.  BULLETS go wild, hitting circuitry EXPLODING APART cannisters of combustible chemicals.  In seconds, FLAMES are licking across the laboratory floor. Blade drops, causing a pair of vampires to FIRE their gun one another. Then Blade knocks two more vampires onto their asses with foot sweep.  Then he's up again.  Slamming the bridge of fifth vampire's nose into his brain with a palm heel stri A snap kick, an overhand elbow strike, a knee stamp that shatter's the vampire's knee cap.  An upward block, a jab cross, a shin kick aimed at a vamp's quadriceps. Overhand punches, rising punches, parallel punches, spinn rear elbows, deep kicks, on and on and on and on in an or of super-hero violence until -- WHAM!  Blade cuts the last of the vampire soldiers down, turning from the creature's disintegrating body to face -

dialogues.speaker: REINHARDT
dialogues.text: The vampire mercenary clutches Blade's sword in his hand, the weapon provides him with little sense of security giv that he's just seen a dozen of his men slaughtered.  The automatic sprinkler system is on now, spraying water down upon Blade and Reinhardt alike.  Blade advances. Reinhardt's been cornered.  There's nowhere else for him run.  Refusing to be cowed, Reinhardt SCREAMS and brings sword down at Blade's head when WHOOSH -- But Blade swings his hands upward, slapping them on eithe side of the blade, trapping the sword on its downward arc Reinhardt strains, trying to tear the sword away from Bla grip.  The vampire's eyes widen in fear.  And during that split-second in which the two men are frozen, connected b the weapon which vibrates between them, Blade says:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something, chief.  Can you blush?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWHISH!  The sword twists free from Reinhardt's grasp, spinning upward into the air.  Reinhardt stumbles backwar against the blood cask railing as -- Blade catches the sword on its way down, swinging it arou in one fluid motion, slicing Reinhardt's torso in half, a with a diagonal axis!  Reinhardt sinks to his knees as th TWO HALVES split apart, turning to ash before they hit fl Beat.  Blade stands beneath the spray of the overhead sprinklers, rinsing the blood from his body.  He turns towards the exit, sword in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A set of elevator doors open, disgorging Damaskinos.  Bey the lobby windows we can SEE a waiting helicopter, VAMPIR SOLDIERS readying it for take-off.  Damaskinos rushes acr the lobby and is almost at the exit when -- CHUNK!CHUNK!CHUNK! A series of steel shutters slam down o the doors and windows.  Damaskinos tries to tug one of th shutters upwards, then moves to a keypad nearby.  He star hurriedly tapping in a numeric sequence when we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I overrode the security codes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos spins around.  Nyssa stands behind him.  She's Whistler's rail-gun in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're locked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you insane?  He'll kill us both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's better that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS if in response, a GRINDING SHUDDER comes from the elev doors.  Damaskinos spins in wide-eyed horror, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it going to be, Damaskinos? Thiavolos.  The devil you know --

dialogues.speaker: BLADE
dialogues.text: enters the lobby from a mezzanine above, sword in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- or the devil you don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos turns back to his daughter, making a last appe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vampire dialect; subtitled) For God's sake, Nyssa!  Let us out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM!WHAM!WHAM!  Nomak pounds away.  The elevator doors a starting to buckle, then they tear apart completely --

dialogues.speaker: NOMAK
dialogues.text: bursts into the lobby, ROARING.  If anything, he is even animalistic now, his features having become grossly distorted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in vampire dialect) Why are you frightened, father?  The prodigal son has returned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damaskinos scurries backwards, but there's nowhere left t run.  Nomak descends on him, lifting the vampire into a r crushing embrace, chomping his elongated canines into Damaskinos' throat. Damaskinos SQUEALS like a child as his life-blood is suck out of him.  His body begins to cave inward, shrinking an twisting until there's nothing left but shriveled husk. Nyssa hefts the rail-gun and FIRES at Nomak's back.  Noma HOWLS, releasing Damaskinos' body, then turns, focusing h blood-drunk gaze on Nomak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (alarmed) Get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Nyssa stands her ground, rachetting back the slide on rail-gun, readying to unleash another barrage of needles. Nomak CHARGES, moving at unbelievable speed.  She FIRES AGAIN, aiming at Nomak's chest -- but then Nomak is upon her.  He slaps the rail-gun from h hands, SMASHING IT TO PIECES. Then he wraps his hand around her throat, pulling her forward, sinking his teeth into her neck.  Nyssa SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyssa!!!

dialogues.speaker: ON BLADE
dialogues.text: as he leaps from the mezzanine level, sword extended, lik Beowulf diving to slay Grendel.  He PLUNGES the sword dee into Nomak's upper torso.  Then DRIVES it in even further Nomak releases Nyssa and back-hands Blade across the face sending him sailing through the air.  He lands, skids acr the floor --

dialogues.speaker: ON NOMAK
dialogues.text: stumbling backwards into the wall.  The sword has sunk so deep that the tip is actually protruding out his back, SCRAPING a gash across the wall as Nomak slides towards t floor. Nomak GRUNTS, then reaches for the pomeel with his ruined hand.  He grips the pommel and SNAPS the sword-blade in h Then he SLAMS against the wall, forcing the half of the broken blade that's still embedded in him out back throug the front of his chest.  As Nomak rises to his feet -- Blade is on him again, snap-kicking the Reaper in the che Nomak retaliates.  Blade somersaults out of the way, then springs back again, KICKING Nomak in the face, BREAKING Nomak's NECK.  Nomak's head lolls unnaturally sideways fo heartbeat and then Nomak swings his head around, somehow righting his neck vertebrae with a snap of his head. They trade blows, a brutal death-match that seems to defy gravity.  Blade moves in for a round-house punch, but Nom catches his fist, holding it for a split-second, then ben Blade's hand at an unnatural angle, SNAPPING his wrist bo The pain is enormous. Nomak starts beating the living shit out of Blade, pummel him with his fists, gripped by an uncontrollable rage.  H SMASHES Blade against a marble column, cracking it.  Then flings Blade against one of the brushed steel walls - so that Blade's body actually leaves an indentation. Before Blade can recover, Nomak is in front of him, launc another kick.  Blade rolls his head out of the way, barel avoiding Nomak's boot heel which dents the wall.  Nomak k a second time.  Blade avoids Nomak, but third time's the charm and Nomak lands one squarely in Blade's gut. Blade falls beneath a flurry of blows, unable to defend himself any longer.  Blood stains his eyes, obscuring his vision.  He strikes out blindly, but Nomak has forced him the ground, pinning him there.  As Blade struggles to fre himself --

dialogues.speaker: NOMAK
dialogues.text: lowers his head towards Blade's face.  The scar/seam in Nomak's chin splits open and Nomak's lower jaw flares apa distending and widening to reveal the awful, glistening h maw -- the hollow inner fangs and striated cartilage whic are closing about Blade's face.  Blade twists his head violently to the right, then glimpses the broken tip of h sword resting a few feet away.  He reaches for it in desperation, plunging it up into Nomak's chest.  Nomak HO Because the hilt has been broken off, Blade is forced to the cutting edge of the weapon with his bare hands.  It slices into his fingers -- but Blade just grips the broken sword tighter, ignoring t pain, driving it deeper and deeper -- until, suddenly, it penetrates the cartilaginous shell around Nomak's heart a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in vampire dialect) Blood brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nomak smiles, covering Blade's hands with his own.  He lo blade in the eye, then drives the broken sword home. Nomak's body stiffens, his eyes grow unseeing, an oddly serene look spreading across his tortured face.  A patch BLACKNESS begins radiating outward from his chest, moving over his body, carbonizing him from within.  As his black flesh begins to crack, BLUE FLAMES flicker out from the fissures.  In seconds, Nomak is gone. Beat.  Blade stands, exhausted.  Then he looks to where N rests.  He moves to her side, kneeling beside her.  She smiles up at him, bravely, but frightened all the same. Blade inspects the wound on her neck.  It's clearly fatal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with genuine sadness) Not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
